title: Taylor offers qualified apology to Moore
text:
Energy Minister Angus Taylor has offered an apology to Sydney Lord Mayor Clover Moore for berating her over the council's travel spending but claims the council has multiple versions of a report that was the source of his attack.

Mr Taylor released evidence which he argued exonerated his office of allegations someone forged a document that was supplied to Sydney's Daily Telegraph newspaper to criticise the council's declaration of a climate change emergency.

Energy Minister Angus Taylor insisted in Parliament that he relied on a document downloaded from the City of Sydney website. Dominic Lorrimer

The figures Mr Taylor's office supplied to the journalist showed the council spent almost $16 million on councillors' domestic and international travel, and was downloaded from the council's 2017-18 annual report on September 9.

However, the council insisted the figure was much lower: about $6000 for councillors' travel, and when employees were added the total travel bill was was $229,000. Those figures are available in the version of the annual report easily found on the website.

Late on Friday afternoon, Mr Taylor issued a statement saying there were multiple versions of the annual report on the website. He provided screenshots that suggested his office had obtained a different version of the document.
description: Energy Minister says local council had multiple versions of the same document he relied on to attack Sydney Mayor Clover Moore over climate change.
